tracks.description:
Серенада № 13 соль-мажор, K. 525
Маленькая ночная серенада

Помимо серьёзной музыки Моцарт сочиняет на заказ лёгкую развлекательную музыку для придворных балов, для вечерних или ночных концертов, которые в летнее время устраивались в дворянских садах. Одним из популярных жанров того времени является и серенада. Так появляется "Маленькая ночная серенада" - жизнерадостное и необыкновенно гармоничное по форме воплощения произведение великого мастера. Музыка весёлая, быстрая и довольно приятная.
tracks.title: Mozart - Serenada №13 in G major (Eine kleine Nachtmusik), K525 IV. Rondo.Allegro

tracks.description:
The New England Conservatory Philharmonia led by guest conductor Marcelo Lehninger perform Mozart's Overture to The Magic Flute. Recorded live October 27 2011 at NEC's Jordan Hall. 
For more information: http://necmusic.edu/concerts
tracks.tag_list: mozart wolfgangamadeusmozart amadeus classical philharmonia philharmonic live boston newenglandconservatory marcelolehninger bostonsymphony
tracks.title: Mozart: Overture to The Magic Flute

user.description: New England Conservatory educates and trains musicians of all ages from around the world, drawing on the talent and deep reservoir of experience of our distinguished faculty. We are dedicated to inculcating the highest standards of excellence and nurturing individual artistic sensibility and creative growth. Understanding that music is one of the transcendent expressions of human civilization, NEC aspires to ensure it a central place in contemporary society. Additionally, we present over 1,000 free concerts a year in our world class performance spaces which include historic Jordan Hall.

user.description:
Mozart — reimagined, respected, and kept alive.

This SoundCloud is a home for original music and contemporary arrangements inspired by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart—made for (and by) Mozart lovers everywhere. You’ll hear everything from elegant, classical-first interpretations to modern reworks with new harmony, rhythm, texture, and production—always with the spirit of Mozart close to the centre.

Who was Mozart?

Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart (1756–1791) was born in Salzburg and became one of history’s most extraordinary musical minds. A child prodigy trained by his father Leopold, Mozart toured Europe early, absorbing the musical languages of his time and astonishing courts and audiences with his playing and composing.
As an adult he moved toward a more independent life—especially in Vienna, where he wrote many of his greatest works while navigating the realities of patronage, commissions, shifting tastes, and financial pressure. Despite a short life, his output is vast, varied, and astonishingly refined: music that can be dazzlingly complex yet effortlessly human.

What did he write?

Mozart’s catalogue spans almost every major form of the Classical era—each elevated with his gift for melody, harmony, drama, and clarity.

Operas: from sharp comedy to profound emotional theatre—The Marriage of Figaro, Don Giovanni, Così fan tutte, and The Magic Flute.
Symphonies: especially the late masterpieces including Symphony No. 40 and “Jupiter” (No. 41).

Concertos: above all the piano concertos, where Mozart practically invents a new kind of dialogue between soloist and orchestra.
Chamber music: string quartets (including the “Haydn” quartets), quintets, serenades, and beloved works like Eine kleine Nachtmusik and the Clarinet Quintet.

Sacred music: including the dramatic, unfinished Requiem, alongside masses and motets.

Mozart’s music endures because it’s both architecturally perfect and emotionally direct—bright, mischievous, tender, tragic, luminous—often within the same page.

What you’ll hear here

Original compositions shaped by classical craft and modern imagination

Contemporary arrangements inspired by Mozart’s themes, forms, and spirit

A wide palette: cinematic, intimate, playful, dramatic, minimal, or bold—depending on the piece

If you love Mozart, follow along—new releases land here regularly.

Official MOZART artist persona of Tom Connell (PRS writer).
IPIs: 
•Tom Connell 671594418 
• Mozart 1187246925 
• Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart 1187246827 
USCO: SR 809-097 (Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, pseud 2017).
Modern recordings/arrangements by Tom Connell; not affiliated with historical estates/publishers.
